On 16 January 2014 14:31, Ryan Hall <ryanhallcs@...> wrote:
>
> In the latest version of SharpNeat (2.2) downloaded from http://sourceforge.net/projects/sharpneat/files/. There is
> a subtle but high impact bug in using FastAcyclicNetworkFactory.cs that switches activation functions for nodes
> through an incorrect id transform.

FYI, a fixed version is now checked into the sourceforge SVN repository.

As a side note - In the released code the bug affected only the Walker
2D (HyperNEAT) problem domain, as this is the only experiment in the
core code base to use acyclic networks for the HyperNEAT CPPN.

Thanks again for spotting this and reporting it.

Colin.
